thread.title: Slayer, Lamb of God Team for 'Feel Good Event of Summer' Tour
thread.title_full: Slayer, Lamb of God Team for 'Feel Good Event of Summer' Tour

title: Slayer, Lamb of God Team for 'Feel Good Event of Summer' Tour
text:
Two of metal's heaviest hitters, Slayer and Lamb of God , will team up this summer for a North American tour. The opener on most dates will be the Polish extreme-metal group Behemoth. Related Slayer Reflect on 'Seasons in the Abyss' Egyptian Video Odyssey Tom Araya, Kerry King recall playing at Sphinx's feet, bribing locals and rocking out in a tomb 
The trek will kick off in Bemidji, Minnesota on July 12th and wrap in Phoenix in late August. Tickets for most dates go on sale this Friday, while for two festivals that Slayer and Lamb of God are playing (without Behemoth) – Wisconsin's Rock Fest and Rock USA – are already on sale. 
Slayer are still supporting their 2015 release Repentless , as well as a recently released, like-titled comic book. The group's guitarist, Kerry King, said in a statement that he saw this tour as unique because all the bands are "old friends." "The potential for greatness at these events is mind blowing," he said. "I look forward to being a part of it, and hanging with old friends – bands as well as fanatical fans! Let the festivities begin!!" 
Lamb of God are also supporting a 2015 release, VII: Sturm und Drang . Singer Randy Blythe echoed King's sentiments. "This tour is gonna be the feel-good event of the summer: The gigs are gonna be like the Haight-Ashbury during the Summer of Love in '67! OK, so that's complete bullshit. It's gonna be absolutely nothing like that, so don't show up with flowers in your hair looking for free hugs or anything stupid like that. It will definitely be a good fucking time though (as long as your definition of a good time means brutal, caustic and hideously loud music)." 
Behemoth last put out a record in 2014, titled The Satanist . Singer Adam "Nergal" Darski said that he was excited to tour with "these living legends" for the trek. "We are also stoked about coming back to North American shores for the last time before kicking off the next album cycle," he said. "Come and join this extreme metal feast with us!" 
Slayer, Lamb of God and Behemoth Tour Dates 
July 12 - Bemidji, MN @ Sanford Center July 13 - Cadott, WI @ Rock Fest 2017 * July 15 - Oshkosh, WI @ Rock USA 2017 * July 16 - Chicago, IL @ Chicago Open Air Festival July 18 - Columbus, OH @ Express Live! July 20 - Raleigh, NC @ Red Hat Amphitheater July 21 - St. Augustine, FL @ St. Augustine Amphitheater July 23 - Philadelphia, PA @ Electric Factory Outdoors July 25 - Boston, MA @ Blue Hills Bank Pavilion July 27 - New York, NY @ Theater at Madison Square Garden July 28 - Baltimore, MD @ Pier Six Pavilion July 30 - Nashville, TN @ Municipal Auditorium August 1 - Bonner Springs, KS @ Providence Medical Center Amphitheater August 2 - Denver, CO @ 1st Bank Center August 4 - Las Vegas, NV @ The Joint/Hard Rock Hotel August 5 - Los Angeles, CA @ The Forum August 9 - San Francisco, CA @ Bill Graham Civic Auditorium August 11 - Eugene, OR @ The Cuthbert Amphitheater August 12 - Seattle, WA @ WaMu Theatre August 14 - Dawson Creek, BC @ Encana Events Center August 15 - Fort McMurray, AB @ SMS Equipment Stadium August 17 - Missoula, MT @ KettleHouse Amphitheater August 19 - Albuquerque, NM @ Isleta Amphitheater August 20 - Phoenix, AZ @ Comerica Theatre 
* Behemoth will not perform
